description: A GET on /v2/<tenant>/servers/<server_id>/os-instance-actions returns an empty list even if actions are recorded in the db.  This is due to "'key' in object" not working on sqlalchemy models since they don't have a __contains__ method.
title: instance actions list empty

comments.content: A GET on /v2/<tenant>/servers/<server_id>/os-instance-actions returns an empty list even if actions are recorded in the db.  This is due to "'key' in object" not working on sqlalchemy models since they don't have a __contains__ method.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/22068
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/22068
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/479254f368ecfb78bf6913dc26230e378999436e
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 479254f368ecfb78bf6913dc26230e378999436e
Author: Andrew Laski <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Feb 15 15:20:23 2013 -0500

    Fix key check in instance actions formatter.
    
    The 'key in object' check doesn't work for sqlalchemy models so nothing
    was getting copied over during the format.  This patch switches to using
    get() to retrieve a value.
    
    Bug 1126593
    
    Change-Id: I726c2a624928247de41a077c23fe80742cbf9044
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
